content: Yes, inherited genetic factors can increase the risk of developing allergies in certain individuals. If one or both parents have allergies, their children may be more likely to have allergies as well. However, genetics alone do not determine whether someone will develop allergies. Environmental exposures such as allergen exposure, lifestyle factors, and infections can also play a role in the development of allergies. Additionally, the inheritance patterns of allergies are complex, and not all individuals who inherit genes for allergies will actually develop them.
